sentences.en: He is utterly despotic to [ toward ] his subordinates .
sentences.cn: 他对 部属 极为专横.

sentences.en: He was despotic, and she liked freedom; he was worldly, and she, perhaps, romantic.
sentences.cn: 他专横独断, 她却爱好自由; 他耽于利欲, 她却也许有点罗曼蒂克.
他的这种桀纣之行令人发指.

sentences.en: In order to prevent the establishment of a despotic regime, Kant demanded a separation of powers.
sentences.cn: 为了防止形成专制统治, 康德要求权力分立.

sentences.en: People rose up against the despotic rule of their potentate.
sentences.cn: 我们的校长是个专横的人.

sentences.en: She become so morose and despotic, that her rule become intolerable.
sentences.cn: 她变得如此孤僻和专横, 以致她的统治让人无法忍受.

sentences.en: The country was ruled by a despotic tyrant.
sentences.cn: 该国家被一位专横的暴君统治着。

sentences.en: The money is running short , discontents are arising beneath these despotic rulers.
sentences.cn: 在这种专制统治之下, 经济日益困难,不满情绪日益增长.

sentences.en: The unchecked power of despotic rulers oppressed women the poor the continent - Europeans in around the globe.
sentences.cn: 欧洲大陆的妇女、穷苦民众,还有世界上其他种族的人饱受专制统治者在世界范围内的肆意压迫.

sentences.en: We just can't stand despotic clauses like this.
sentences.cn: 对这种霸王条款,我们就是气不忿儿!

trans.tran_cn: 专制暴君的，似暴君的，专横的，暴虐，豪，豪强
trans.tran_en: If you say that someone is despotic, you are emphasizing that they use their power over other people in a very unfair or cruel way
